channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9895] 0.96 Import utility can't import an exported file from 0.94
item.description:
Basically we PBed org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Result so a 0.96 cluster cannot import 0.94 exported files. This issue is annoying because a user can't import his old archive files after upgrade or archives from others who are using 0.94.

The ideal way is to catch deserialization error and then fall back to 0.94 format for importing.
item.summary: 0.96 Import utility can't import an exported file from 0.94

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
No good way to dynamically determine an input file format in 0.94 so introducing a system property such as following in order for Import to load a file using 0.94 deserializer.


./bin/hbase -Dhbase.input.version=0.94 org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.Import <table name> <input folder>

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12612519/hbase-9895.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 4 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.TestRegionServerCoprocessorExceptionWithAbort

This message is automatically generated.
This looks like magic to me; where is setConf(Configuration) called on the Serialization instance? When will getConf() be non-null?
class ResultSerialization is extended from Configured. Therefore, when mapreduce initializes those class and configuration will be passed to the new instance automatically(magically).
Alright then. Any chance of adding some kind of test? Maybe a data blob that matches the old format? Looks good otherwise.

I added a test case. Since there is no way to put the binary 0.94 exported file, the new test case testImport94Table will fail in the QA run.

The new test case run fine in my local env with the binary file is put hbase-server/src/test/resources/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/exportedTableIn94Format.
The sample file is small. Can we add it as a src/test/resource ?

This message is automatically generated.

The sample file is small. Can we add it as a src/test/resource ?

The binary data file is added into src/test/resources/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/exportedTableIn94Format. As I mentioned above, patch file can't contain binary file so I have to attach the binary file separately and QA run will fail. When commit the change, I'll commit the binary under src/test/resources/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/exportedTableIn94Format along with the text patch file. Therefore, there won't be any issue.

+  public static final String INPUT_FORMT_VER = "hbase.input.version";

There is no comment above the constant definition.
FORMT is not a word. Did you intend to say FORMAT or FROM ?
That's a typo and should be INPUT_FORMAT_VER. I'll fix it and add comment when I check in the patch. Thanks for the good catch!

This new test is exactly what I had in mind, perfect. Can you confirm that it's cleaning up the temp filesystem after the test ends, make sure it's not abandoning any cruft in the run directory.

Was removal of testMetaExport intentional?

Thanks Nick Dimiduk for the good catch. The missed test case is added back. The temporary file is cleaned after each test.

The v3 patch contains Ted Yu and Nick Dimiduk feedbacks. Thanks.
Excellent. +1

+1 for trunk and 0.96. Please add nice release note since it is my guess a few folks will be looking to see if this facility is present in 0.96 going forward.

Nice patch +1.
Please change the param name "hbase.input.version", to be hbase.import.version. I guess this can be used with -Dhbase.import.version override when launching the job.

Thanks for all the reviews! Enis Soztutar I'll rename config setting name to "hbase.import.version" when I commit the change.
Stack Yeah, I'll add a release note on this. Thanks.
Thanks for all the reviews & feedbacks! I've integrated the patch into 0.96 and trunk branch.

Jeffrey Zhong This option should be documented in the usage (run with no args) and in the refguide here http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#import . Mind doing a follow on and adding documentation (cut and past of new usage would be great)? See importTsv for a similar example.
ok, let me add some notes there.
